column4: Lathiat, Chibi: my data is just fine, the thing just refuses to mount now
it has my home directory and all my music, so I'm very upset about this. 30 minutes ago was when this little machine reinstall was supposed to end for the night :(
what happened?
no idea :(
why are you upset then?
this has happened to me in the past, it was an old IDE cable
I don't follow, your hard drive went dead or smth?
no, kernel driver error is my guess
what are the symptoms?
check /etc/mtab
I removed it from fstab with no effect. Now I'm removing the scsi drivers from /etc/modules
fstab is not related, mounted drive info is in /etc/mtab
it is not a setup problem, its a kernel level software problem
the reiserfs 3 drivers are ... fragile in my experience
reiser3 is very stable, but I still don't get what the problem is :)

well I tracked it down to a driver initialization problem. If I put my scsi drivers in /etc/modules, it fails to mount. if I wait until after boot and just mount the drive, it works. Dunno if the drivers will be found if I just try a mount at boot without /etc/modules having the scsi drivers
and it is definately some bug in the reiserfs fs driver. I can do everything else, including a fsck
you should probably have your driver within kernel or load it on boot or tinker with initrd
perhaps I should try it. In the past, the driver did not work right when compiled into the kernel
it is possible that this scsi driver is not set up with an appropriate dependancy as well - after all, it is pretty new (2.6.9)
probably, don't blame reiser right away
it has just been a few times in the past, it has been reiser
that means its mounted and this message is generated by reading /etc/mtab and is not related to filesystem
it is an error returned by the reiser kernel driver, there is nothing in mtab
